title: Auditory output
description: Where ICT provides auditory output, the auditory output shall be available without requiring the use of hearing.
checklistItem: Check that auditory output is available and can be used with headphones or other assistive technology.
swedishGuidance: For public terminals (e.g. ticket machines) auditory output must be available for screen reader functionality.

title: Tactilely discernible parts
description: Where ICT has physical controls, these must be tactilely discernible.
checklistItem: Check that physical buttons and controls can be identified by touch.
swedishGuidance: Important for self-service terminals in the public sector.

title: Operable parts discernibility
description: Where ICT has operable parts, these must be visually discernible.
checklistItem: Check that buttons and controls have sufficient contrast against the background.
swedishGuidance: Also applies to touch screens on public terminals.

title: Non-text content (non-web documents)
description: Non-web documents shall satisfy WCAG 2.1 Success Criterion 1.1.1.
checklistItem: Check that all images in documents have alternative text.
swedishGuidance: PDF documents and E-books (EPUB) must have alt-text. MTM supervises e-books compliance.

title: Keyboard (non-web documents)
description: Non-web documents shall be navigable by keyboard.
checklistItem: Check that documents can be navigated with keyboard (Tab, arrow keys).
swedishGuidance: PDF forms and E-book navigation must be operable via keyboard/reading systems.

title: Document titled (non-web documents)
description: Non-web documents shall have a title.
checklistItem: Check that documents have a descriptive title in metadata.
swedishGuidance: PDF documents must have title set in document properties.

title: Object information (software)
description: Software shall expose object information to assistive technology.
checklistItem: Check that UI elements expose name, role, value, and state to screen readers.
swedishGuidance: Mobile apps from public authorities must work with iOS VoiceOver and Android TalkBack.

title: Authoring tool accessibility (software)
description: If the software is an authoring tool, it must support accessible content creation.
checklistItem: Check that CMS/authoring tools have features to create accessible content (e.g. alt-text fields).
swedishGuidance: CMS used by authorities must encourage/require accessible content.

title: Accessibility and compatibility features
description: Product documentation shall describe accessibility features.
checklistItem: Check that documentation lists all accessibility features and how to use them.
swedishGuidance: Accessibility statement must include information about accessibility features. Applies to public sector (DOS-law), private actors (Accessibility Act), and E-book distributors.

title: Accessible documentation
checklistItem: Check that user manual and help documentation meet WCAG 2.1 AA.
swedishGuidance: Help pages and user guides must be accessible. Critical for e-commerce and banking services under the Accessibility Act.

title: Information on accessibility and compatibility features
description: Support services shall be knowledgeable about accessibility features.
checklistItem: Check that support staff is trained in the product's accessibility features.
swedishGuidance: Support services (helpdesk/technical support) must be able to assist users with disabilities. Applies to all actors covered by the Accessibility Act.

title: Accessible support services
checklistItem: Check that support is available via multiple channels (phone, email, chat) and is accessible.
swedishGuidance: Support channels must be accessible. Private actors offering services to consumers must ensure their support is inclusive.
